name: Clarion Collection Gabelshus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Impressive exterior and very nicely decorated reception and public areas. The staff were very friendly and the atmosphere was nice & cosy. Our room was spacious and modern, the bathroom clean with a great shower. The breakfast buffet was very good with lots of choice. Didn't try the free evening buffet, but have heard that it's very good as well.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not a great hotel. Didnt enjoy our stay in this hotel and found the reception staff to be very rude and not helpful.
reviews.title: not as per expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Clarion Collection Gabelhaus has figured out how to make travelers relax and feel at home.
reviews.title: A thoroughly wonderful three-night expereince

likes.liked: — Virtually everything...including the attitude of the staff. The Mgr. took a shift on recpetion!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: This hotel in the embassy neighborhood of Oslo has it all....free parking, location, access to public transportation, amentities, great breakfast, waffles in the afternoon, free soup, salad and home-made bread in the evenings.
reviews.title: Great hotel off the beaten path

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in the summer so the rate was more competitive than shown.
reviews.title: Good value in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: In a quiet, upscale, residential area of fine homes and apartments. Around the corner are Ambassador's residences. Two blocks from hotel is the convenient Number 13 Tram. Also two blocks to Bygdoy Alle, a nice shopping street. We loved this neighborhood!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel: Our room was a minisuite in the new wing. This was a wonderful room which was huge with a large bath with good shower stall and slick modern fixtures. It was beautifully decorated and so comfortable. Breakfast was superior and the complementary supper was good enough that we skipped the expense of restaurants. Nice outdoor seating area in front of hotel to eat, drink and people watch.
reviews.title: Areal Oslo gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not miss Vigeland Scuptures in Frogner Park. A must do, wonderful sculptures in a beautiful setting. Also took ferry to Viking Ship and Kon Tiki Museums. Do not miss City Hall and National Art Gallery. We loved Oslo!
reviews.title: Peaceful and Relaxing stay

likes.liked: — Complimentary breakfast, evening meal and espressos/water
likes.disliked: — the Bathroom in the second floor room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights and found the hotel excellent. Our bedroom was in the annexe with a good sized bathroom and a view over the street one way and over gardens the other. It was clean, airy and a good size with a TV which had many European channels. The breakfast was very comprehensive with cold and hot buffet, plenty of different bread loaves, fruit and hot and cold drinks. The evening "snack" was a real bonus as it saved at least £25 per person per night eating out. While limited in choice, soup, extensive salad buffet with chicken wings or pasta or assorted sausages and bread galore with the chance to go back as often as one wished made it a real 'hit' for us. Shops are just a few minutes away and the local tram (12 or 19) took 5 mins to the city centre. A wonderful quiet area of Oslo with many interesting houses near by. When we required a taxi, reception rang for one and it came within 5 mins each time. While not in the noisy centre of Oslo we would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Needs better management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were skeptical at first, found a pretty good deal through 'Norway in a Nutshell' and all reviews pointed to an outdated hotel outside the city center. The first night we stayed we had a great modern room on the first floor in the back which was absolutely perfect since we needed to have a quick nap and nice shower. The bathroom was WOW and the room was oohhh, ahhh.
reviews.title: Great choice in Oslo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Gabelshus is the perfect hotel for business travellers. It is very conveniently located nearby the main train stations and shopping areas. It is clean, modern, with free Internet access and still has a charm. The evening meal is really good and very convenient, specially during the winter. My employer has special rates for this hotel but it can be a bit pricey sometimes. Be aware that taxis in Oslo can sometimes take very long in the morning on Thursdays and Fridays.
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at the Clarion Gabelshus this summer. Our experience was wonderful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience at Gabelshus!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is located in what I would term the "Embassy District" of Oslo, so it is not within walking distance of the central train station, where we arrived. You can, however, take a tram to a stop just a block or so from the hotel (ask at the TI desk at the station, and watch out for pickpockets as you exit the station!). From the station the ride was about 10 minutes or so.
reviews.title: Excellent Oslo base!

likes.liked: — Value for money (Bed, Breakfast and evening meal in cluded in the price)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: It is well worth the tram trip, however. The hotel is situated in a quiet part of Oslo, perfect for strolling on a nice summer evening. You can walk down to the harbor or over to Vigeland Sculpture Park.
reviews.title: Charming ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are good-sized for Scandinavia, and the linens were nice. The room was extremely clean, modern, and well-decorated. Bathroom was clean and modern as well, although the shower was quite tiny (but perfectly serviceable). The lobby and dining areas of the hotel are just perfect for spending some quiet free time. There is a small "library" with books and a computer with internet access for guests to use. There is also a breakfast area and a large front porch which has several tables available for guests to eat outdoors. The staff was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, quiet neighbourhood.

likes.liked: — quiet neighbourhood, walking distance to downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We book this hotel through the Norway in a Nutshell tour.
reviews.title: Good hotel with spa

likes.disliked: — old fittings in the bathroom and not very clean corridors and windows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were quite happy.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel, room size variable, poor wheelchair access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not in the very centre of Oslo, but quite easy to reach on foot (without luggage) or by tram. It is in a quiet nice quarter west of the centre and not far from the new area of the harbour (Aket brygge).
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite good; only there are some fittings that are a little old, especially in the corridors, but also in the room and bathroom.
reviews.title: excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is sufficiently clean and warm.
reviews.title: OK but expensive

description: A stay at Hotel Gabelshus offers a deep dive into the culture and history of Oslo. The interior is composed of historical details and fantastic paintings. Being in the heart of an elegant residential area and in walking distance from Vigelandsparken, Aker Brygge and the Royal castle you are guaranteed an exciting stay in Oslo.The hotel offers tasty meals in a charming atmosphere with access to our popular terrace for outside dining. Enjoy your breakfast or complimentary evening meal surrounded by murals reflecting the history of the area. The special atmosphere of the dining room and lounges around has been a background of various fashion shoots.Hotel Gabelshus offers a range of salons with a relaxing atmosphere- the hotel library has a dignified style where you can relax with a book, watch TV or enjoy a glass of wine. The so- called fireplace room is furnished with antique furniture and calming colors offering relaxation in comfortable armchairs in front of the open fireplace.Hotel Gabelshus has a long and exciting history. The mansion was erected in 1912 and was originally a lodging house. The three first managers and owners were women, one more special than the other. Miss Sommerfeldt who ran it from 1933-45 lived herself in the building with her two parrots that had free access to anywhere in the building. She ran the place in a caring and authoritative manner at daytime and used to relax with her guests smoking a pipe in the evening.
